commentary.text: Back for the chase. Sehwag and Pujara to open
Richardson to Pujara,1 run,swings in full first ball and is timed to mid on's left, Faulkner dives and parries it away
Richardson to Sehwag,1 run,moving in and rising from back of a length now, Sehwag tucks it to fine leg
Troy: "Watching Steve Smith reassures me that the Australian team is in safe hands. What a player he's become! Top notch."
Richardson to Pujara,1 run,tailing in again, worked off the pad to fine leg
Richardson to Sehwag,1 wide,short and coming in, but slipping down leg this time
Richardson to Sehwag,no run,short once more, ending around off this time, Sehwag goes on his toes and keeps it down
Richardson to Sehwag,1 run,this keeps coming in, but Sehwag still creates some space to glide it to third man
Richardson to Pujara,no run,this does not come in and goes past the outside edge as Pujara pushes forward to defend
Kulkarni to Sehwag,no run,flashes at a wide outswinger and misses it
Kulkarni to Sehwag,no run,good length and right on the stumps, defended carefully
Kulkarni to Sehwag,no run,follows up with a bouncer, Sehwag ducks
Kulkarni to Sehwag, $$OUT$$ ,Sehwag sees deep point, and Sehwag will take him on of course, he slices this widish back of a length ball straight to the man however
Kulkarni to Saha,1 run,opens the face and runs a length ball to third man
Kulkarni to Pujara,no run,moving away outside off, left alone
Faulkner to Saha,1 run,full into the pad and turned in front of square leg
Faulkner to Pujara,2 runs,Pujara wristily turns this length ball from middle and leg to deep square
Faulkner to Pujara,1 run,walks out and dabs a length ball past slip to third man

Faulkner to Saha, $$OUT$$ ,they're picking out the fielders, although this is a sharp, tumbling take by Kulkarni at deep backward square leg, he's swung a short of a length ball and Kulkarni has not had to move much
Faulkner to Pujara,1 run,turned wide of mid on
Faulkner to Maxwell,1 leg bye,tries to turn this shortish ball square on the leg side, but misses and they take a single as it rolls towards point
Kulkarni to Maxwell,no run,tries to whack a length ball down the ground but it moves away and beats him
Kulkarni to Maxwell,1 run,short of a length, worked to mid on's rigth
Kulkarni to Pujara, $$FOUR$$ ,this is one shot Pujara plays with lots of aggression, width outside off, and he cuts hard behind point
Kulkarni to Pujara,no run,tries another cut but is done in by the extra bounce
Kulkarni to Pujara,no run,slower and fuller, he taps it to extra cover
Kulkarni to Pujara,no run,lovely delivery, angled in just outside off, makes him play, and straightens and kicks past the edge

Richardson to Maxwell,1 run,a  $$chance$$ , Maxwell moves down the track and to the leg side, bowler follows him with a slower one, he pops it back in the air, but it is just out of Richardson's reach

Richardson to Pujara,1 run,sitter  $$dropped$$ , Tambe settles under this leading edge at mid on and it goes straight through his hands to smack him on the face, he indicates he lost it in the lights, Pujara was trying to forcefully whip it over square leg
Richardson to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,picked cleanly over deep square leg, full into his pads, and Maxwell sends it soaring
Richardson to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,now he goes over mid on, goes back and to the leg side, and swings it over the infield
Richardson to Maxwell,1 run,follows him with a full one as Maxwell makes more room outside leg, but can only dig it out
Richardson to Pujara,no run
Tambe to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,first ball of legspin is flat and angled in, Maxwell's slogged it in front of square leg
Tambe to Maxwell,1 leg bye,he sets himself up for another mow over the leg side, but this hits the pad and rolls fine
Tambe to Pujara,1 leg bye,shuffles across and is hit on the pad with a googly
Tambe to Maxwell,no run,he stands miles outside leg before the ball is bowled, somehow misses one bowled flat but slower, stayed a touch low too
Tambe to Maxwell,1 run,slogs a very full one to deep midwicket, along the ground
Tambe to Pujara,no run,comes out and slaps it straight to point, did not have width
Faulkner to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,a full toss to start the over, Maxwell uses his wrists and swats it over deep square leg
Faulkner to Maxwell,2 runs,slogs a length ball, hasn't got hold of it, but it clears midwicket
Manish : "Hate to say this but Pujara not looking the part in T20.. Would still be thrilled if I am proved wrong."
Faulkner to Maxwell,1 run,that could have gone too, back of a length down the pad, and Maxwell disdainfully helps it in the air, but fine leg is in the way
Faulkner to Pujara,1 run,dabs a length ball to point and goes for a quick single
Faulkner to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,Maxwell goes off side this time, this is short and leaving him on the angle, he takes a couple of steps out, and forehands it over backward point
Faulkner to Maxwell,1 run
Tambe to Maxwell,1 run,comes out a tossed up ball, takes it on the full and hits it to long on
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,charges out and forces it through extra cover
Tambe to Maxwell,1 run,bowled slower outside off, Maxwell slogs, a thick inside edge runs behind square leg
Tambe to Pujara,no run,comes down the track and flashes it straight back to the bowler
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,comes out again and swings hard, mishits to long on
Tambe to Maxwell,no run,angled flat into the pad, Maxwell misses as he goes down on a knee

Dhrumin Nandola: "I think Pujara is playing well and is very vital to Punjab. He's not hogging the strike, taking singles and giving Maxwell enough strikes. There needs to be an anchor for Punjab and Pujara is doing just that."
Bhatia to Pujara,1 run,106.8 kph to begin from Bhatia, it does not come on for Pujara who forces it in the air down to long on
Bhatia to Maxwell,1 run,cut away for a single
Bhatia to Pujara,1 leg bye,steps out, Bhatia angles it in full, Pujara misses, and they scamper a leg bye
Bhatia to Maxwell,no run,full and slow again, hit back to the bowler
Bhatia to Maxwell,1 run,89.2 kph, he will give you no pace at all, Bhatia, Maxwell tries to power it over the leg side, it falls well short of deep midwicket running forward
Bhatia to Pujara,1 run,full one hit down to long on
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,Pujara charges out, but only manages a thick inside edge to square leg
Tambe to Maxwell,no run,full and quicker on the pad, he tries to whip it square but misses
Tambe to Maxwell,no run,Maxwell misses another one, he steps out looking to go over square leg but is hit on the pad
Tambe to Maxwell,1 run,almost bowled him, 91.9 kph full delivery pushed through, Maxwell plays it rather uncertainly, and only an inside edge saves him
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,mishits a slog down to long on
Tambe to Maxwell,1 run,full just outside off now, Maxwell looks to drill it over extra cover, but only hits it along the ground to long off, is cross with himself
Bhatia to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,he sets himself up for the reverse sweep even as Bhatia is about to release the ball, and connects the low full toss to beat short third man
Bhatia to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,Maxwell brings up 50 with another reverse sweep that clears point very comfortably
Bhatia to Maxwell,no run,now he tries to slog to leg, and Bhatia's slower one keeps very low to beat him, that was very close to leg stump too
Bhatia to Maxwell,2 runs,waits and places this full delivery wide of long off for a couple
Bhatia to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,third reverse in the over, and third boundary, this time he goes way in front of square, dragging the full delivery over the infield, no chance for the sweeper
Bhatia to Maxwell,1 wide,Bhatia angles it in and sends it down the leg side
Bhatia to Maxwell,1 run,a loopy slow and low full toss, Maxwell turns it through midwicket
Kulkarni to Maxwell,no run,sharp stop from the keeper, this was a wide away swinging full toss and he got a thick edge to it, it was travelling but Samson reacted in time
Kulkarni to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,third man is up, this is short and wide, and Maxwell hops to cut it miles over the man
Prabhakaran R: "The only way to control Maxwell in this IPL is to bowl a lot of slow deliveries. He tends to smash every delivery which has decent pace!!"
round the wicket
Kulkarni to Maxwell,1 wide,sends it full down the leg side now
Kulkarni to Maxwell,no run,well bowled, he angles it full and wide of the right-hander this time
Kulkarni to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,then he sends in a low full toss on the pad and Maxwell flicks it between deep square leg and deep midwicket
Kulkarni to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,shot, there is no width here, full and on middle stump, but Maxwell has opened the face and timed it in the gap past extra cover
Kulkarni to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,terrific, a full toss, Maxwell opens the face even more and drives through the covers for four more, he is toying with the field
Bhatia to Pujara,2 runs,Pujara manages to force one straight down the ground as he charges out, Rahane comes racing from long on, dives across and stops it a few inches from the rope
Bhatia to Pujara,1 run,another one swung over the bowler, Rahane will cut it off easily this time
Bhatia to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,full, slow and on the stumps, Maxwell is backing away to leg, and has carted it high over long off
Bhatia to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,what a show, slower length ball down the pad, Maxwell bends his knee and smacks it in front of square
Bhatia to Maxwell,2 runs,loopy full delivery hit wide of long on for two more
Bhatia to Maxwell,1 run,length ball worked to deep midwicket

Ozee: "For those who might think Maxi is just good for T20....they are absolutely wrong....he has a very good technique , has got a calm head....and has got all the shots....he can well and truly rule all the three formats."
Richardson to Maxwell,1 run,low full toss, he drives with an open face to the sweeper
Richardson to Pujara, $$FOUR$$ ,Pujara swings at a full delivery, and a thick inside edge runs fine down the leg side
Richardson to Pujara,1 run,moves across and whips this full one wide of fine leg, but is getting only one
Richardson to Maxwell,no run,tries to square drive a full and widish one but is beaten
Richardson to Maxwell, $$OUT$$ ,Maxwell departs finally, he mishits this full delivery, it goes straight and high, stays airborne for an age, but Smith at long on judges it neatly
Richardson to Pujara,1 run,Pujara goes straight and aerial now, on the bounce to long on who's run across
Binny to Pujara,1 leg bye,shout for lbw as he misses trying to turn a low full toss to leg, probably sliding down
Binny to Miller,no run,cuts across the left-hander from back of a length, is pushed back
Binny to Miller,2 runs,length on the pads, turned in front of square leg for two
Binny to Miller,no run,tries to launch this length ball over midwicket, inside edges onto pad
Binny to Miller,2 runs,full and wide, smeared through extra cover, Bhatia throws himself to his left at sweeper cover and saves the boundary
Binny to Miller,no run,skidding across him from a length and he cannot do anything with it
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,Pujara gives this full delivery everything, but it just rolls across the outfield to long on
Jay : "Pujara is looking like a fish in the desert."
Tambe to Miller,1 run,steps out and clips a full delivery to long on
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,had walked outside off trying to go leg side, but this was bowled slow and full, and he dabs it to third man
Tambe to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,flat wrong 'un, shortish too, Miller goes back and flat-bats it into the sightscreen
Tambe to Miller,1 run,comes out, but cannot get under the ball too well, drives it to long off
Tambe to Pujara,1 run,Pujara steps out and heaves, manages a single to long on, what a struggle it has been
Faulkner to Pujara, $$FOUR$$ ,out of nowhere, Pujara's connected with a scoop, he goes outside off, bends the knee and turns this length ball to the fine leg rope
Faulkner to Pujara,3 runs,flays a back of a length ball high over extra cover, hasn't timed it, and sweeper keeps it inside with a dive
Faulkner to Miller,no run,very low and wide full toss, slips under Miller's bat swing
Faulkner to Miller,1 wide,this is too wide outside off now
Faulkner to Miller,1 run,slower one picked from outside off and slogged on the bounce to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Pujara,1 run,Pujara cranks up and has a slog, but he can only mishit it tamely through midwicket
Faulkner to Miller,2 runs,full and wide, Miller reaches out and lifts it over covers, sweeper reaches it on the bounce and parries it in
Kulkarni to Pujara,1 run,Pujara tries to scoop this from way outside off stump, but he edges it into his body instead, scampers a single
Kulkarni to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,low full toss, around off, Miller steps forward and launches it over long on
Kulkarni to Miller,2 runs,full and wide, Miller gets some bat on it, they go for the second as long off rushes forward, throw is at the keeper's end but Miller is alright
Kulkarni to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,Miller with another maximum, one more full toss from Kulkarni, Miller crashes it over extra cover
Kulkarni to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,third one of the over, Kulkarni tries a slower one, Miller takes it from just outside off, and swats it in front of square leg
Kulkarni to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,Miller's ended the game this over, this is full and wide, Miller slices it hard and flat, and it falls onto the deep point rope
Faulkner to Pujara,1 run,in another universe, Pujara keeps on heaving and inside edging, and also keeps getting the hitters on strike
Faulkner to Miller,2 runs,slower length ball, Miller waits and pulls it wide of deep midwicket for a couple
Faulkner to Miller,2 runs,wide low full toss, Miller places it in the air through the covers, and comes back for two more
Faulkner to Miller, $$SIX$$ ,Miller ends it with plenty to spare, he goes to 51 off 19 as he gets low and slices it over cover again
That is all for tonight. Good bye

Maxwell is the Man of the Match. Maxwell: "I would not say pay back [for sitting on the bench at Mumbai Indians last season]. Mumbai had a pretty good side last year. I had to bide my time. I have a plan for each ball, just try and hit different gaps. Depending on the field they set, I know where the ball is going to be. Worries me more that I was not there at the end to hit the winning runs, that was a job half finished."

Bailey: "Once again some extraordinary batting from Maxie and David Miller. Credit to Rajasthan, they bowled well at the start, hit their lengths better than we did, we fell behind, but the way Maxie and Miller batted, it was not an issue. Obviously we would not like to be chasing as many, that would be ideal."

They chased 206 against Chennai, they have chased 192 tonight. Chasing down two big totals in successive games is a big confidence boost for the side, says Maxwell. He and Miller did it in both games. If one thought Maxwell's effort was spectacular, what about Miller, who's blitzed six sixes in 19 balls.

Harshal: "Pujara may not have been as explosive as the other batsmen, but he managed to hold an end up, and go at better than a run a ball, which was enough to see them through. This struggle may actually help the guy find some form for later in the tournament, as leading a successful run-chase through from start to finish will do wonders for his confidence. But what about Mad Max and David Miller. Smashed everything everywhere. Some decidedly ordinary medium-pace bowling helped them on their way, but its one thing to talk, and another to execute and smack every poor ball away for four or six. Incredible chase."

name: Rajasthan Royals v Kings XI Punjab
